meanings.definition: To rouse to action or effort; stir up; arouse.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise bestirred the sleeping dog from its nap.
meanings.sent2: She bestirred herself to finish the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies bestirred him from his laziness.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speech bestirred the team to victory.
meanings.sent5: The urgent phone call bestirred him into immediate action.

meanings.definition: To put into motion or activity; rouse.
meanings.sent1: The gentle breeze bestirred the leaves on the tree.
meanings.sent2: He bestirred the crowd with his powerful speech.
meanings.sent3: The smell of coffee bestirred her from her morning grogginess.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news bestirred the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock bestirred him from his deep slumber.
